active_learning.discussion_prompt: Compare CiC classification with government schemes like CUI: Debate the pros/cons of adopting CiC in the private sector for protecting trade secrets versus using standardized CUI markings. Consider compliance burden, flexibility, and enforcement.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student teaches the other about CiC controls mapped to NIST SP 800-171 (e.g., access control, incident response); switch roles and quiz using sample scenarios.
active_learning.problem_solving: In a simulated data breach, classify 10 leaked documents as CiC or not, then design a step-by-step protection plan including marking, storage, and third-party sharing protocols.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Commercial in Confidence (CiC) Classification' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Information and Asset Handling > Asset Identification and Classification > Information Classification > Commercial in Confidence Classification). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to generate high-quality, pedagogically optimized flashcards. **Completed Research Context:** Commercial in Confidence (CiC) is proprietary organizational information (trade secrets, financials, strategies) whose disclosure causes commercial harm. Key aspects: proprietary nature, commercial sensitivity, organizational control, contractual obligations. Differs from CUI (government-defined). - NIST SP 800-171 Rev 3 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/171/r3/final): Protects CUI; applicable to CiC via 110 controls (access ctrl 3.1.x, awareness 3.2.x, media prot 3.8.x). - NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final): Controls like AC-21 (sharing), MP-3 (marking), SC-28 (transmission) for classified info handling. - ISO/IEC 27001:2022 (https://www.iso.org/standard/27001): A.8 Asset mgmt/classification. - ISO/IEC 27002:2022 (https://www.iso.org/standard/27002): Guidelines for classification/handling. Big picture: CiC enhances Confidentiality in CIA triad, fits asset lifecycle, aids compliance/risk mitigation. Builds on general classification (Public/Internal/Confidential). **Instructions:** Generate exactly 50 flashcards following the schema. Distribute: By Bloom's (8-10 per objective level); By layer (12-13 each). Vary formats. Ensure SMART alignment, active recall. Output as JSON array of objects with 'front' and 'back' keys (back as object). No duplicates; web-grounded accuracy.
